questions.question: For which of the following purpose strength tests are performed

answers.a: To ensure good strength so that mould does not collapse
answers.b: To ensure bonding strength so mould retains its shape
answers.c: To ensure that mould retain its shape when the patter is removed
answers.d: To ensure gases pass through easily in the mould

explanations.a: Strength tests in foundry operations are primarily performed to ensure that the Mould has sufficient strength to withstand the forces exerted during the casting process. This includes the weight of the molten metal, thermal stresses, and mechanical handling. Ensuring good strength helps prevent the Mould from collapsing during casting, which can lead to defects in the final product.

questions.question: What do you understand by the green compressive strength of foundry sand

answers.a: Property of the green sand to withstand the compressive stress
answers.b: Ability of the sand to be easily stripped off the casting after it has solidified
answers.c: Maximum compressive strength a mixture can develop before it collapses
answers.d: Minimum compressive strength a mixture can develop before it collapses

explanations.a: The green compressive strength of foundry sand indeed refers to the maximum compressive strength that the sand mixture can develop before it collapses. This strength is crucial for ensuring that the sand can support the weight of the molten metal during casting without deforming or collapsing.
